subject: Photography
title: Chiaroscuro: Light Meets Dark
description: A 60-second lesson on Chiaroscuro: Light Meets Dark.

hook.text: Caravaggio painted figures emerging from darkness â€” lit faces floating in black. Photography borrowed his technique.

buildup.text: Chiaroscuro is the bold contrast between light and dark used to create volume and dramatic tension.

discovery.text: The technique makes subjects look three-dimensional and emotionally intense. Light carved from shadow.

twist.text: It requires darkness to work. Without deep blacks, the bright areas lose their power. Contrast is the point.

climax.text: From Caravaggio to film noir to modern portrait photography, chiaroscuro has endured for four centuries.

punchline.text: The oldest lighting technique is still the most dramatic.

quiz.question: What is chiaroscuro?
options: Bold contrast between light and dark to create volume and drama
